thread.title: ISIS thug who 'killed prisoners with DIESEL injections' FOUND in refugee camp
thread.title_full: ISIS thug who 'killed prisoners with DIESEL injections' FOUND in refugee camp

title: ISIS thug who 'killed prisoners with DIESEL injections' FOUND in refugee camp
text:
“It may be that my friends misunderstood this” Ahmad Al I 
Death cult jihadi are infamous for their monstrous atrocities committed in lands they occupy – often filming the killings for disturbing propaganda films, sometimes using ISIS children to shoot prisoners . 
The Syrian repeatedly denied he was an Daesh fighter during the trial. 
But an investigation discovered he had ISIS propaganda material on his mobile phone and tablet. 
Ahmad Al I claimed he worked for or the humanitarian service of the Free Syrian Army and had worked in Turkey as a cook. 
The alleged chef he worked with in Turkey testified he had only worked with him for two weeks, reports Der Standard. 
CEN ISIS: Migrants in the camp reported Ahmad Al I after his boasts of atrocities 
CEN MIGRANT: ISIS fighter Ahmad Al I had Daesh propaganda on his tablet and phone 
He claimed he had not boasted about the executions – saying the witnesses misunderstood him and had been talking about what he had seen on the news. 
Ahmad Al I said: "It may be that my friends misunderstood this. But that evening I was very drunk." 
He is understood to have travelled more than 1,500 miles through Europe as a refugee to arrive in Austria from Syria. On patrol with the Iraqi forces driving ISIS terrorists from Mosul Wednesday, 18th January 2017 The city of Mosul has been an ISIS stronghold since they took control of the city in January 2014. The Iraqi army claim to have taken it back, and defeated the Islamist terrorists. 1 / 12 CTS soldiers fatigued from battle. Related videos
